application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
TPO 40
(T10) Robinia (R.pseudocacacia) - Reduce crown by 30% (2.5m) to suitable growth points; reduce lateral branch length to match, shape and tidy; remove all deadwood branches.

CONSERVATION AREA:
(T1 - T4) 4x Olive (Oleo europaea) - Reduce all crowns by 30% to suitable growth points to shape, balance and tidy; crown lift where necessary removing or cutting back branches.

(T5) Pittosporum - Reduce crown by 25% (1.5m) to suitable growth points; reduce side growth to shape and tidy; lift lowest branches.

(T6) Pear (Pyrus communis) - Remove large dead stem to ground level; thin remaking crown section by 15%; remove any deadwood branches. 

(T7) Large Monterey Cypress (Cupressus macrocarpa) - Section fell to ground level.

(T8) Silver Birch (Betula pendula 'Jacquemondii') - Reduce crown by 25% (1.75m) to suitable growth points; reduce lateral branch length to match.

(T9) Silver Birch (Betula pendula 'Jacquemondii') - Reduce crown by 25% (2m) to suitable growth points; reduce lateral branch length to match; remove LH hanging stem to base level; retain RH slender stem to maintain balance.
